text: Jan Wincenty Maciejko (2 January 1913 — 21 October 1993), was a Polish ice hockey goaltender. He played for Cracovia Kraków during his career. He also played for the Polish national team at the 1948 Winter Olympics and several World Championships. During the invasion of Poland at the onset of the Second World War he served in the Karpaty Army and was wounded near the town of Biłgoraj, and later fought with the Home Army. For this he was made a knight of the Virtuti Militari. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1913 births Category:1993 deaths Category:Ice hockey players at the 1948 Winter Olympics Category:Knights of the Virtuti Militari Category:KS Cracovia (ice hockey) players Category:Olympic ice hockey players of Poland Category:Polish ice hockey goaltenders Category:Sportspeople from Tarnów Category:Polish Austro-Hungarians
title: Jan Maciejko
